\hypertarget{md__home_jr_Code_GitHub_Luna_EXAMPLES_autotoc_md1}{}\doxysection{Math}\label{md__home_jr_Code_GitHub_Luna_EXAMPLES_autotoc_md1}
LunaR supports executing literal math expressions directly and will print the output automatically if one is detected.


\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{›››\ 2\ +\ 2}
\DoxyCodeLine{}
\DoxyCodeLine{Output\ ⇛\ 4}
\DoxyCodeLine{(took:\ 0.01ms)}

\end{DoxyCode}



\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{›››\ 2\ +\ 2\ *\ 8}
\DoxyCodeLine{}
\DoxyCodeLine{Output\ ⇛\ 18}
\DoxyCodeLine{(took:\ 0.01ms)}

\end{DoxyCode}



\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{›››\ 2\ +\ 2\ \%\ (1\ +\ 1)}
\DoxyCodeLine{}
\DoxyCodeLine{Output\ ⇛\ 0}
\DoxyCodeLine{(took:\ 0.01ms)}

\end{DoxyCode}
\hypertarget{md__home_jr_Code_GitHub_Luna_EXAMPLES_autotoc_md2}{}\doxysection{Variables}\label{md__home_jr_Code_GitHub_Luna_EXAMPLES_autotoc_md2}
To create a variable in Luna, you simply give it a name and assign it a value\+:


\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{›››\ x\ =\ 2}
\DoxyCodeLine{(x\ ⇛\ 2)}
\DoxyCodeLine{}
\DoxyCodeLine{›››\ msg\ =\ 'hello!'}
\DoxyCodeLine{(msg\ ⇛\ 'hello')}

\end{DoxyCode}
\hypertarget{md__home_jr_Code_GitHub_Luna_EXAMPLES_autotoc_md3}{}\doxysection{I/O}\label{md__home_jr_Code_GitHub_Luna_EXAMPLES_autotoc_md3}
To print a value to the console, you can use the {\ttfamily print} function\+:


\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{›››\ print\ 'hello'}
\DoxyCodeLine{⇛\ hello}

\end{DoxyCode}


To read a value from the console input, you can use the {\ttfamily input} function\+:


\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{›››\ x\ =\ input}
\DoxyCodeLine{x\ ⇛\ <some\ input>}
\DoxyCodeLine{}
\DoxyCodeLine{›››\ print\ x}
\DoxyCodeLine{⇛\ <some\ input>}

\end{DoxyCode}
